characters: A DIGITAL READOUT ABOVE THE EXIT DOOR READS
THE SOUND OF A GUNSHOT RINGS OUT
HANGAR DOORS BEGIN TO RUMBLE OPEN
CU ON CARRIE'S HAND TUGGING ON THE ZIPPER
THREE DIFFERENT TYPES OF CANNISTERS WITH RUSSIAN WRITING
-- EXPLODES INTO A FIERY ERUPTION OF FLAME AND DEBRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow-covered hills thrust up out of a barren, white wasteland. No buildings, no animals... nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSER: The hills are more defined. Rows of jagged peaks and a crazed pattern of crevasses. A fine `mist' of wind-blown snow whips about this jumble of glinting ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STILL CLOSER: We track down through valleys, skirt crevasses, climb peaks and finally pause on a flat stretch of ice. HOLD on this scene of timeless, savage beauty, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FACE, hooded and goggled in ECW (extreme cold weather gear) drops into frame, smashing down on the icy surface with such brutal impact, the shattered goggle shield pops out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- EYES STARE BLANKLY into camera -- locked in death. It's a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera slowly starts to PULL BACK to see his limbs have snapped at unnatural angles, the head grotesquely twisted -- bright red arterial blood seeps from the corpse and spreads out down tiny cracks in the ice until, with startling speed, it turns dark and freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PULL BACK further and look down on the body, a bizarre shape in a spider's web of frozen blood. And SLOWLY WE PULL BACK... further and further...until all is dazzling white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sounds of lapping surf and distant seagulls serenades us like a rhythmic lullaby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- CU on WOMAN'S TOES digging up soft, white sand.    The shadow of a palm tree cascading over top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Widen slightly -- a pair of feminine hands, donning an ANTIQUE SILVER ring on the left middle finger, are slowly applying coconut tanning lotion onto firm, athletic calves. Deep. Soothing. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O.C. KNOCK KNOCK on a door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hands stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another KNOCK KNOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lapping surf and seagull sounds come to an abrupt halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly annoyed) ...Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Widen to meet CARRIE STETKO, late 20's. Cargo pants -- rolled up, and an exercise top. She's kicking back, but she's not at the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact, she's in an office, sitting on a chair. A NEWLY OPEN BAG OF KITTY LITTER sits next to a plastic tub she's got her feet in. Two FLOOR LAMPS stand like sentinels above her, blasting her with warm wattage. A fake palm tree casts the shadow across her body. She's pulled the earplugs out of her iPod -- back to the real world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens. Leaning into the room is JAMIE CLARK (20's), African-American. She's dressed in a flannel shirt, jeans. Carrie doesn't look entirely happy at the intrusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, a Professor Sapperstein needs to see you in biology. Said it's urgent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Carrie gets to her feet, camera moves away from her, panning around the small office. Half-packed up boxes lay strewn about the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CALENDER hangs crookedly before a desk. Each day has been marked off with a large X. THREE DAYS REMAIN unmarked. Last space reads: WINTER-OVER, and in the space next to it, there's a cut out picture of a tropical beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dart board is next to it with A PHOTOGRAPH pulverized with dart holes over the Bullseye. It's of a candy- striped pole topped with a silver ball, surrounded by international flags - the South Pole. Carrie is standing next to the pole, smiling at the camera, arm-in-arm with SAM MURPHY (30's). Looks like he's handsome, but his face is a little more obliterated than the rest of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ugly sprawl of prefab buildings, power-lines and above ground sewage pipes. It looks more like a Siberian work camp than Antarctica's largest research base and logistics hub. In the background, smoke rises from Mt. Erebus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An icy wind HOWLS, but the base swarms with PARKA-CLAD FIGURES shuttling supplies and packing up equipment for winter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PICK UP CARRIE AND FOLLOW her as she strides down the icy, unmade street. Her hood is pulled up and she's not enjoying the cold. She reaches a row of buildings and checks the names - GEOLOGY LAB #2...ASTROPHYSICS - BERKLEY...until she reaches BIOLOGY BUILDING #7 and pushes through the double doors into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONG BENCHES are covered with ANTARCTIC FLORA - MOSSES, LICHENS and LIVERWORTS. They are being nurtured and studied by SCIENTISTS who look like homeless people - unkempt beards, bloodshot eyes and sun-damaged skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie throws back her hood and unzips her jacket. Approaches one of the scientists with familiarity, who is in the process of EXTRACTING an ICE-CORE SAMPLE from a stainless steel cylinder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SARCASTIC) Hey Fred, unlock any secrets of the Universe -- discover we're Alien life forms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Workin' on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one's Sapperstein?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deschampsia Antarctica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He indicates with a nod to a bench covered with tall grass samples across the room. PROFESSOR SAPPERSTEIN, young, thin and bearded, is studying them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crosses to him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Sapperstein?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanted to see me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face tenses -- this is serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads her to a bench in the corner on which stands a GLASS HERBARIUM containing only STALKS and a few HEAT LAMPS. One of the GLASS PANELS has been smashed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAPPERSTEIN (cont'd) They took it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cannabis Sativa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAPPERSTEIN (cont'd) My weed, man. I've been growing it all summer and they took it. (BEAT) It was just budding, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sends an evil glare across the room to four glassy- eyed scientists sitting around a desk, munching on potato chips, candy bars, and drinking beer. Stifling laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAPPERSTEIN (cont'd) (GLARING) It's not funny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie looks back to him -- can barely stifle a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Sapperstein, I'd like you to read something for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls out a small LEATHER FOLD chained around her neck. Opens it up. Puts it in front of his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) What's this say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not sure what she's getting at --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) C'mon, go ahead, read it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie Stetko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: United States Marshal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes the fold, lets it drop around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good. (BEAT) Now are you still sure you want to report the theft of an illegal narcotic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He actually ponders the question for a moment. Carrie puts an arm around his bony shoulder and steers him away from the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Professor...are you planning on doing the winter-over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not this year, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. And how are you feeling right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm crazy? Is that what you're saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (PACIFYING) No, no, not crazy. But this time of year, down here, we're all going a little toasty aren't we? How about you plant a little Cannabis when you get home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pats him on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie enters. Walks by a mirror. Takes a glance. Is about to fix her hair, then stares at the reflection -- what's the point? We notice a slight scar on her right temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps around the moving boxes to her desk, which is bare except for a thick BINDER labelled,`DAILY REPORTS'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a seat, opens a binder and flips past dozens of empty pages reading "INCIDENT: None. ACTION TAKEN: None." On today's page she fills in the blanks with "Theft of botany sample." And "None."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pencil falls down onto the desk before her. Bounces. Then rolls off. She doesn't even flinch, or look up. Just stares unhappily at the binder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera tilts up -- several pencils are stuck into the cardboard tiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes the binder and puts it on the shelf beside a row of framed photos: Carrie in a Marshal's uniform graduation day; crisp, clean uniform. She and two other girlfriends, all smiles, at a bar -- she's got a birthday cake in front of her. Carrie on a beach somewhere, sitting in a chair, feet in the sand -- shaded by a palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she lifts the frames and moves to pack them in a nearby box --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You busy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to see SAM MURPHY, base commander, the guy on the DART BOARD. There's an awkward beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? (BEAT) I know you weren't in the area. What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees the photo on the dart board -- saunters over to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a pilot at ASB who thinks he spotted a popsicle out on the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What flavor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we were doing so well. (BEAT) Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClain Valley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This throws her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McClain Valley? What was he doing out there? That's no man's land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a closer look at the photo -- almost seems amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a plane heading to ASB in an hour with some supplies for Winter-over. (BEAT) Can't get you back until tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her with a smile --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MURPHY (cont'd) You leaving the dart board?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- just the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The red and white striped ceremonial south "pole" stands surrounded by international flags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER TITLE: South Pole / Amundsen-Scott Station (USA)

dialogues.speaker: P
dialogues.text: opulation: 183                Temperature: - 55В°

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice as far as the eye can see. In the background is the base. It's much smaller than McMurdo - a few dozen specialist buildings surrounding four circular buildings raised on hydraulic stands, interconnected by tubular shaped walkways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off in the distance -- A SNOWCAT mounted with a plow, pushes small drifts of snow off the runway onto a LARGE BERM. It's been busy -- SEVERAL OTHER BERMS flank both sides of the runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera pans to Carrie with a gear bag in tow, as she deplanes a LC-130. A HALF-DOMED HANGAR rises up on the other side of the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The main ASB complex is before her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the top of the entrance is a huge poster: 3 DAYS TO WINTER-OVER EVAC. Piles of packed equipment are everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half a dozen NAKED MEN wearing only boots and face masks blow out the front door screaming and yelling, run around the South Pole, right past her, and back into ASB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie heads in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bottom of the frickin' planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music cranks. Carrie knows her way. People come and go as she strides along a corridor decorated with PARTY BALLOONS and signs that read: `DON'T FORGET THE EVE OF EVAC PARTY' -- comes to an office door with a small plaque on it that reads: MARSHAL. Pushes it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie enters. It's smaller than her McMurdo office with a HOLDING ROOM that has a viewing window in the door. A fine layer of dust blankets a little desk with a computer and lamp on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A map of Antarctica is spread across a wall with sub- station positions marked in block letters. A window gives view to the South Pole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie opens the door. Single bed. Tiny dresser. No frills. She tosses her gear bag onto the bed. Closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie pokes her head in. An examination table, cabinets with drugs and first aid equipment. A couple of hospital beds. Moving boxes are packed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another door in the back of the room is open, but the light is off. Carrie turns to leave and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- almost bumps right into one of the runners from outside, Aussie RUSSELL KELLER (late 20's) coming down the corridor. He's naked, except for a towel wrapped around his waste. Sports a goatee. Couple tats. Flashes a cocky smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hello Marshal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves.    He falls into stride with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) You seen Doc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out back.   What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checking the freezer for a popsicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It got called in this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who spotted it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy, one of the pilots here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keller half smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's his first year down here. You know how that goes. My bet it was just debris, an old tent or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah -- probably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's an idea -- why don't you stay here with me and we'll party, just the two of us. Put those cuffs of yours to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Were you the second guy from the front?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come to the end of the hall.   Keller stops.   Carri goes right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large room by base standards. Several windows. A giant map of ANTARCTICA dominates one wall with the International stations and research outposts flagged with pins that have their countries flags on them.   A grid of EVAC TIMES of each STATION and OUTPOST is next to it. A Tech is changing a few.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another TECH sits as a console, lined with comm equipment and computers. Others hustle about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talking into a headset is the Station Manager, RHONDA STEWART (30's). Silky white skin. Irish. Long red hair tied back. Perfunctory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have them boomerang back and pick up the load -- just have it ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tech at the console turns to her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys got the science lab all shut down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, have them check all the pressure levels on the hydraulics, then clear the exterior storage bins. Make sure we're not leaving anything out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda sees Carrie coming in the doorway. There's a flash of awkward tension that both mask with professional demeanor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam told me you'd be coming up -- how's the sleigh ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. I need a plane and that pilot who saw the popsicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have him meet you in the hangar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of silence lingers as neither have anything else to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selecting a putter from a bag of golf clubs is DOC FURY, 60. Looks seasoned. Bearded. Wears the only non-red parka we've seen: it's royal blue, trimmed with black fur and emblazoned with dozens of emblems and patches from years of Antarctic service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In less than three days we begin Winter-over. The sky will go completely black and stay that way for six months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera pulls back to REVEAL five NEWBIES (first-timers); an Asian, French, Brazilian, Danish and an American. All are standing on their jackets, shivering uncontrollably in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC (cont'd) The sane ninety percent of the population will be leaving the ice. Extreme weather conditions make it impossible for planes from the outside world to land. You have chosen, for your own misguided reasons, to stay. And it is my responsibility to teach you beakers how not to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc lines up on a hot pink golf ball and putts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ball rolls across the glacier in an impossible, wind- driven arc, approaches a flag, and sinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC (cont'd) Time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Asian holds a stopwatch.    He stares at it stupidly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T... T... Three minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your core body temperatures have fallen to approximately 97 degrees. You are shivering uncontrollably -- losing basic motor skills. You're having trouble focusing on even the simplest tasks. In short, you are well on your way to dying, and it has only been two-hundred seconds. (BEAT) Put your coats on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class struggles into their jackets. Doc assists those who, in their diminished capacity, are having trouble figuring out how to put them on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC (cont'd) Your life is dependent on your awareness of the weather. So be aware. There is a condition that arises around here known as a whiteout. Don't get caught in it. Winds kick up snow that's lain on the ice for thousands of years -- can't see six inches in front of your nose. Temperature plummets to triple digits. We found bodies less than a foot from safety and warmth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie walks up.    Doc's eyes brighten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC (cont'd) Class, here we have another of the many hazards found on Antarctica. Say hello to Marshal Stetko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a disjointed, chattering chorus --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Marshal Stetko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always a pleasure to see you. Unlike most of the beaker-heads down here. (BEAT) Social visit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish -- We got a job. I need you to take a ride with me.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) (BEAT) Might be a body out on the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's this crap always happen at the end of the season?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie pulls a Driver from Doc's golf bag.    Lines up another pink ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC (cont'd) Too cold for driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie swings -- WHACK!   The ball shatters and pink bits rain down around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie and Doc cross the interior, which houses Three double prop Twin Otters, two Snowcats, and six snowmobiles. Keller and two other employees are busy working on one of the Otters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your gut say about this body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My gut and I don't talk anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue, after a beat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) I saw your boxes packed up. What was all that BS last month about, "I'm never going back -- I'll die here. Scatter my ashes over the pole"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a beat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People change, Carrie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a card from my Granddaughter inviting me to her fifth birthday party. You know, I've never even met her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or mentioned her. A grandchild? Doc, that's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It got me thinking -- I need to be a better Grandfather, than I was a father. It's time I deal with my life. I've been down here a lot longer than I probably should have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at one of the Otters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BYRON DELFY, a baby-faced, African American pilot leans out the plane's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You Delfy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell they get these thumb-suckers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy smiles graciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brooklyn. And unless your wrinkled ass has a heart attack on my plane, I think we'll be all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy disappears back into the plane.    Doc looks to Carrie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I want Keller. He's my pilot. (BARKS) Keller, get over here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy's taking us, Doc. He's the one who saw the body. C'mon, you'll be fine. I'll even hold your hand if you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ushers him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane soars through a cloudless sky, the sun sparkling brilliantly on the endless ice sheet below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie's in the copilot's seat, wrapped up tight in her ECW, just trying to stay warm. Delfy's at the controls. Doc's in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you doing out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went to evac a camp. Had to fly off route to get around a storm. Got down low to avoid some turbulence, and there it was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie notices a picture of a young boy, around seven, wearing a Yankees cap dangling from the instrument panel. It's framed in popsicle sticks with I LOVE YOU DADDY written around the perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That your son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, name's Nathan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's cute.   Has your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky he got his momma's brain. Kid's smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why aren't you with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bonus pay. Trying to buy a house. Give my boy a yard. His own room. Stuff I never had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Carrie, all bundled up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DELFY (cont'd) Don't like the cold, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why are you down here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie's eyes drift out the window --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all make stupid mistakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy tips the nose of the plane down. The ice below is broken by jagged hills and yawning crevasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's right up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spirals down among the icy hills, visibility is poor. Heavy turbulence suddenly jars the plane sideways -- Delfy laughs at Doc's nervous reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DELFY (cont'd) I don't carry extra panties Doc, so keep it tight. (BEAT) There it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He banks the plane and slips down into a valley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DELFY (cont'd) Three o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Got it.      It's a popsicle alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down below is the body sprawled on the icy ground next to the crevice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Red jacket.   He's American.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Twin Otter is in the distant background. Carrie, Doc and Delfy, who has a gear bag slung over his shoulder, weave their way around huge ice boulders -- skirt small crevasses. Mid-conversation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... It's always different when they freeze. Some curl up. Some stretch out. Some tear their clothes off. They get delirious. What was that guy's name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He's lost in a storm. We can't find him, but we hear him on the radio going on and on about the Serengeti heat and his wife, Janet. Next day, we find him frozen solid, wearing nothing but his bunny boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy stops.    Grimaces.    Drops the gear bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CORPSE is just ahead -- a frozen display of death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all stare at it - the body in unnatural angles, the spiderweb of frozen blood. Delfy looks nauseous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never seen a dead guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy slowly shakes his head, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie moves up to it. Takes a look down the deep crevice four feet away. Can't see the bottom. She walks around to get a look at the face. Blanches slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC (cont'd) You know him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do you. Think his name's Weiss. We Wintered-over last year with him. Played cards a couple of times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy who cheated?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.    Geologist, I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc takes a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie pulls out a DIGITAL CAMERA from a pocket.     Shoo a couple of pics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc takes a look up behind them. The ice steepens sharply to a vast plateau, scattered with jagged boulders of ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC (cont'd) Looks like he fell from up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie pauses with her camera, looks up -- doesn't seem as convinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then where's his crampons -- his gear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc looks around -- she's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe down the crevasse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie glances to Delfy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) What's the closest camp?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brits -- about eighty miles west.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at body - Soto) What the hell where you doing all the way out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc reaches down and tries to move the body -- doesn't budge -- frozen solid into the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah Christ -- he's a sticker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie unzips the gear bag.      Digs out ice two axes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pile of chopped ice is off to the side of corpse. Delfy, who looks very uneasy about all this, grabs the feet as Carrie and Doc each grab an arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going to be alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- this is the kind of stuff that scars you for life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all strain to lift the body from the frozen ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna give myself a Goddamn hernia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They keep pulling and -- SNAP! The arm Doc is holding BREAKS OFF at the elbow. Lands on his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy turns away and pukes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah -- I'm really going to miss this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is peering down at them from the top of an ice cliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Widen to see A MAN wearing a white camouflage parka. Lowers the binoculars. Goggles shield his eyes. He moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOUD MUSIC. A party is in progress. People are mingling, some have drinks, others dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VOLUME of the music dies, replaced by a repetitive SQUEAKING NOISE emanating through the silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People stop what they're doing, and focus on where the noise is coming from, which is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Doc and Carrie ushering a pushcart with Weiss' contorted, frozen body through the middle of the party. His dismembered arm rests across his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The festive mood evaporates quickly as all eyes stay glued to the horrific state of Weiss' body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as they pass OPERATIONS, Rhonda steps out with the Brazilian and French Newbies at her side to see what's going on. Her eyes immediately go to Weiss, then shift to meet Carrie's. Before she can say anything --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who manages the Post Stations?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinkle.   Howard Dinkle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc and Carrie keep moving. Everyone else just keeps silent and watching. Squeaky wheel fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One - two - three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUMP! Carrie and Doc set Weiss' body onto the examination table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) How long to thaw him out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie, let's just bag him and put him on a plane to McMurdo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves over to a sink and gets a cup of steaming hot water from a tap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It bothers me no one's reported him missing yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because maybe no one thinks he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd he get out there?    There were no tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds to me like you and your gut are talking again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie returns with the water.   Goes to pour it on the zipper, but Doc gently puts his hand on hers, stopping her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC (cont'd) Let's ask ourselves if we really need to do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a moment, Carrie understanding, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody wants to get out of here more than I do, trust me, but right now -- we're all this guy has.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slides her hand away from his -- starts pouring the water on the zipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little by little, it starts to move -- then finally, ZIIIIIIIIIIP. The jacket opens up, barely -- like sliced skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc watches as she tries to pry it open further, but can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grab that side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes one half, he the other, and begin to pull. The jacket opens up, like bending metal -- slowly revealing a frozen, but extremely bloodsoaked chest area surrounding A DEEP PUNCTURE WOUND through the shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc's face sags.    Carrie stares at the wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE'S MEMORY HIT: The well defined chest of a man wearing a tight T-shirt. A BULLET HOLE dead center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc looks at Carrie with deep concern -- he's tuned in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stirring up a few things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'll be alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both take a moment looking at the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, this means a Federal Investigation, and we're witnesses. We may get stuck here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc looks to Carrie, gentle, like a dad would his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We both want to do the right thing Carrie -- but we also need to get off the ice. Right now we don't have to say a word. When they find something later -- hey, we didn't know. We were leaving, the body was frozen, we didn't have time to examine it. No one gets murdered in Antarctica. Think about it. Dead is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He eyes her pleadingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly, this is the first murder in Antarctica, Doc -- and I can't just pretend it didn't happen. (BEAT) I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did I know you were going to say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie steps out into the hallway. Takes a moment, leaning against the wall, this whole thing wearing on her more than she's revealed. She tilts her head back. The second it hits the wall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie's beat to shit, soul weary. She's on her knees, full of blood. A man is on the floor between two beds before her. She holds her gun at her side. He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie refocuses.   Pulls away from the wall.    Leaves t memory behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie has a NEXTEL phone/walkie to her ear, making her way up the corridor. Moves past a couple of guys loading a dolly with boxes from an adjacent room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What camp was he with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on my way to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all I need right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure his family's thinking the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I meant. (BEAT) I'll contact the FBI -- see how they want to handle this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up. Approaches a closed door.      Name plate o it reads Dinkle -- SUB-STATIONS MANAGER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O.C. MOANING and GROANING -- great sex. Carrie rolls her eyes. Knocks on the door. No one answers. Moaning continues. She doesn't have time for this. Opens the door to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- a large TV playing a locker-room porno where a quarterback with no pants is giving it to a cheerleader with no top. Half a dozen guys, oblivious to Carrie standing there, CHEER the action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate interrupting educational programming, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHEERING dies as everyone turns to see Carrie standing behind them. Only fake PORNO MOANING remains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) I need to talk to Dinkle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone gets up, thrilled for an excuse to leave. of them nods to Carrie on the way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaplain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie flips a nearby wall switch. Lights kick on. Small room. English flag. There's a Beckham poster and an 8x10 framed photo, turned backwards, hanging on one wall. A large map of Antarctica on another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A proud assortment of tea bags are uniformly lined up along a shelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One guy remains. HOWARD DINKLE.        Thirties.   Englis Bearded. On the heavy side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I in some kind of trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he crosses to her, he flips the 8x10 framed photo back around -- it's of THE QUEEN MOTHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FILE FOLDER drops into frame onto a desktop, which is a map of Antarctica, under glass. File reads: DELTA ONE ONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Widen.   Carrie opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three photos are stapled inside. One is of Weiss, the other two have names written under them -- RUBIN and MOONEY. Mooney is a runty looking guy with a mop of blond hair. Rubin is a skinny, thin faced young guy with a beard that hasn't filled in yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they doing out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collecting meteorites. (BEAT) One One has an extremely old surface with low sediment deposition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: English, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Means it's a good place to look for meteorites. (BEAT) It's right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinkle points to a location on the map.       Delta One O labeled. Boasts an American Flag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it -- Weiss was no where near Delta One One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Dinkle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) When are they scheduled for evac?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One sec --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He refers to a RADIO LOG SHEET hanging off the corner of his desk. Gets uneasy -- can't find what he's looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DINKLE (cont'd) ...They haven't arranged a pickup yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that a little unusual this close to Winter-over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hates to say it, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is. Really unusual, actually. (SCRAMBLING) I guess I should've contacted them, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You've been a little busy. Yeah, I can see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves over to a LONG RANGE RADIO CONSOLE tucked up against a wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) What's their frequency?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventeen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie spins a dial to 17.    Keys the microphone, drawin it to her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into microphone) Delta One One, this is United States Marshall Carrie Stetko, come back, over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Static crackles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Delta One One, I repeat, this is United States Marshal Stetko, come in, over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dull constant static never wavers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts down the mic.   Thinks for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Carrie's NEXTEL RINGS -- takes it off her belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Stetko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshal, it's Jamie. I've got some guy holding from Vostok who won't give his name, says he has to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vostok? (BEAT) Patch it through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Marshal Stetko, who's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Mooney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's thrown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mooney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who I am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie's eyes shift to his picture on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened out there, Mooney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come to Vostok and we'll talk. Only you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Rubin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to Vostok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie is moving at a quick pace. Passes the open door to the clinic. Sees Doc looking through some boxes, a glass of Scotch in hand. She stops. Backs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting drunk already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just gearing my liver up in case I have to stay the next six months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy's contacting the Feds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over to her.    Raises his glass in a somber toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're making my day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do everything I can to get you off this ice, promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you will. (BEAT) What's the hurry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going to Vostok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises a curious brow --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) One of the guys from Weiss' team called.   Wants to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing in Russia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie walks in. Rhonda has a phone to one ear, another in her hand. Looks stressed. She's hovering over one of the Techs who is sitting before a computer screen displaying Satellite Weather Imagery -- think Doppler. His focus is on a VAST STORM SYSTEM that is heading toward ASB, which is marked in RED NEON. Other stations are marked as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're tracking it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a plane to Vostok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda raises her finger -- putting her on hold.      Car doesn't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) I don't control the weather -- you want to stay the winter, then don't be ready for your evac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks to Carrie --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RHONDA (cont'd) Sorry, can't.    All the planes are committed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not asking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to tell the deep drill ice core team getting picked up in four and a half?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them I took their plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie spins.    Leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squat Soviet-ugly buildings, some collapsing, others with boarded up windows, are barely visible through the driving ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STORM LINES of different colors interconnect all the buildings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie and Delfy, wearing full ECW gear, lean hard into the wind, making their way towards the compound. She's carrying a duffle bag. Can barely see the Twin Otter behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER: Vostok Station (Russian Federation) Population: 46                Temperature: -73В°

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie leads the way up a decrepit, dimly-lit hall strung with exposed pipes and wiring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaunt, malnourished faces look up from the rooms they pass. All stare. Silently. Looks more like death row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (WHISPER) What's with this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Russians barely supply Vostok anymore. They have to barter with other bases for supplies. Some of these guys have been rotting here for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie enters a grungy operations room that never made it out of the 70's: ancient computers and steel-cased radios fill one wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One man welds equipment off to the side. Four more Russians sit at a table playing cards and drinking Vodka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all take their time looking her over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's in charge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YURI, a big bear of a man in his forties, gets up from the table. Huge arms. Scruffy face. Bloodshot eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heavy accent) Who's asking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stetko, US Marshal. I'm here to talk to an American named Mooney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yuri smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So many people come through Vostok. Is hard to remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie hoists her duffel bag on the table and unzips it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yuri pulls it open. It's packed with steaks. The Russians react with smiles and the mood lightens. Yuri's grin widens further. Takes out a porno -- there's a Cheerleader on the cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Mooney, yes. I remember now. He offers pay us to fly him off Antarctica on our transport. We give him very good price - because plane leaves a week ago!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Russians laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red storm line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie is suiting up in her ECW gear, rope harness and crampons. Her jacket's open. Delfy has a steaming cup of coffee in his hand. He looks to her gear belt; cuffs, pepper spray, baton...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't carry a gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Against the law -- Antarctica's the only place in the world you can't have one. Part of the Treaty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't that make you feel kind of naked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All this crap on -- I prefer naked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She zips up her jacket.    He glances to a temp readout b the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gettin' worse. Minus eighty-one. Wind at a hundred and ten knots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a sip from his hot coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have to do that in front of me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees that one of her leg straps on her harness needs to be fastened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give you a hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sets down his coffee on a nearby shelf. As he fastens it, Carrie pulls on her goggles and a face mask. They finish at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever been on a rope-line in a whiteout?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. Thoughts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, hold on tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy leaves as Carrie cranks the submarine-type wheel- lock in the center of the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! The door is suddenly yanked from her grasp, slamming open against the building. Wind knocks her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storm sings in an even DULL ROAR. A solid white wall of wind-driven ice blows past. The light is oddly dim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRACK! The coffee mug Delfy left on the shelf, breaks in half, exposing a cylinder of frozen coffee. It rolls across the shelf, falls, and shatters on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie struggles back to the door and clips a three-foot tether from her harnesses to a RED STORM LINE attached to the side of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps into the storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie leans into the door, pushing it closed and locking the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two steps into the storm, the building behind her is gone. Step after step, there's nothing but the guide line and the ROAR of the storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gust of wind lifts her off the ground.     She's caught her tether and smacked down on the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly regaining her stance, she pushes onward. Finally Carrie runs into something. It takes her a moment to realize she's at a building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs the wheel-lock and turns, breaking ice, opening the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unclipping from the line, she closes the door on the HOWLING behind her. Pulls off her mask. Teeth are chattering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spins the wheel-lock of the door going out of the ready room into the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie hits the lights: nothing. No power. Just a sliver of light stabbing in through a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Mooney? Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only silence responds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hallway is long and dark, leading away from her in both directions. She draws a flashlight from her pocket. Thumbs the switch, sending a beam out through the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something doesn't feel right. Slides her baton out from her belt. She decides to go left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking the hall, she tries door after door.   Finally on gives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Mooney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cautiously pushes it open: four stripped bunks in an empty room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moves on down the corridor -- hears COUGHING, like someone trying to clear their throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks ahead, and determines it's coming from behind a closed door at the end of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's confirmed when she hears it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stops at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slowly opens it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now she can hear HEAVY, LABORED BREATHING --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Sweeps the inside with her light. It's a large lounge type room: scattered chairs, tables, and an overturned sofa on the other side -- where the heavy breathing's coming from. Another cough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inching forward, she gets to the sofa. Looks over it to see A BODY -- it's Mooney, lying in a pool of blood. Struggling to breathe through a puncture wound to his esophagus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...My God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to him. As she kneels, he grabs her, GASPING for air, trying to tell her something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie catches a REFLECTION OF MOMENT behind her in his eyes -- someone's coming at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- She instinctively rolls back over Mooney just as -- WHAM! An ICE AXE swings down at her. Just misses her head by an inch, but the shaft nails her arm holding the baton that goes clattering across the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The killer, wearing ECW gear with hood and goggles, takes another swing. She lunges to the side. Axe misses her, but sinks into Mooney. Game over for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie slices the floor with her light, looking for the baton, but can't see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The killer yanks his axe free of Mooney as Carrie bolts around the sofa, heading back out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie blows back into the hallway at a full tilt run, retracing her steps. Her light zigzags. The killer emerges a few beats later on a run. It's going to be close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halfway down the hall, she hangs a hard right toward the Ready Room. Throws a glance over her shoulder -- he's right behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She targets the ready room door -- the orb of her light getting smaller and smaller as she nears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gets there.   Doesn't even want to look back -- it's all or nothing.   She pulls open the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Leaping in, she spins the wheel-lock closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMACK!   The killer HITS THE DOOR from the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She SPINS OPEN the outside door wheel-lock, as the lock on the INNER DOOR behind her starts SPINNING OPEN at the same time. It's a race.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE'S door slams open first and the wind hits her hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls on her mask and goggles just as the door behind her bursts open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie jumps into the whiteout, catching the red storm line and clipping in as she staggers forward. Glancing back, she sees the killer in the doorway, then loses sight of him as she's swallowed in the whiteout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She struggles down the line, buffeted by the storm, but HER HAND ON THE LINE moves erratically -- He's on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She swivels a nervous whirl to see -- the Killer materializing out of the whiteout right behind her.    He clipped into Carrie's line. He raises the axe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swings. She jumps back, losing her footing. Hits the ice hard -- face first. The killer towers over her, raising the axe again. Carrie drives her heel into his knee, knocking him off balance. He drops next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches for Carrie, grabbing her mask, pulling it off. She cries out as the FREEZING WIND catches her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The killer gets to his feet and delivers a rib-cracking kick, flipping Carrie onto her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOUND FADES from Carrie's world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is nothing but her strained BREATHING.   The killer draws back the axe, shiny with frozen blood.   He swings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie UNCLIPS her harness from the tether. THE WIND grabs her, and Carrie SLIDES AWAY -- the killer disappearing from view behind the swirling wall of white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sliding across the ice, Carrie SLAMS into a pole.   Grabs on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cinching her hood down, she searches the storm with no idea which way to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie glances up the post. Barely visible through the blowing ice are signs pointing different directions: "Moscow 17,030 Tokyo 13,329 Fiji 7,877 Los Angeles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls herself up and heads out, leaning into the wind. Carrie staggers blindly, trying to protect her face. Falling, she gets up, and struggles on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her drunken gait increases as she continues to lose heat. A rope catches her in the neck. It's another storm line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie lurches forward, holding the line with one arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, she bumps into something. It moves. It turns to face her. IT'S THE KILLER AGAIN. He swings. She deflects the blow with her free arm, and manages to grab the axe head. The killer tears the axe free, taking Carrie's glove with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swings again, but Carrie pulls hard on the rope, throwing him off balance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The axe cuts through the line. The killer hits the ground, and is immediately ushered away in the wind, as Carrie, clinging to the rope, slides over the ice like a pendulum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line goes tight; she's jerked to a stop. It takes everything she's got to get to her feet. She slowly struggles up the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More dead than alive, Carrie stumbles against the door and grabs the wheel-lock with both hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unable to bend the frozen fingers of her left hand around the wheel, she struggles to turn it. Finally it gives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings wide and she stumbles in. But she's caught; her bare hand frozen to the metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ripping it free, her SCREAM is lost to the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie falls, collapsing against the door.       Blackout

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A single bulb above casts a cone of light down onto Carrie, who's leaning against a sink, staring at herself in a mirror. She looks stressed. Her Marshal's badge dangles around her neck.   Wears a shoulder harness. The bathroom door behind her is open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She catches a REFLECTION of a shadow moving across the room behind her. Body tenses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she turns --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She withdraws a 9mm from her harness -- eases toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gun ready, she rolls her back around the jam -- WHAM! Carrie's blindsided by a fist that drives her into the other door jam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before she can recover -- a guy, dark eyes, unshaven, grabs her by the hair and runs her head first into the bathroom mirror. SMASH. It's brutal. Shards fall into the sink, as Carrie's RIGHT TEMPLE goes bloody. She drops to the floor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE'S POV - A BLURRY FIGURE stands over top of her. She's still got some fight in her -- hands lash out in a frenzy, like a cat in water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Jack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wo wo wo.   It's okay, it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure materializes around her.     It's Delfy, holdi her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie slowly settles, then she's out again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's lying on a table, wrapped in blankets. An old, WRINKLED FACED RUSSIAN MAN slowly lowers her wounded hand -- pale white and missing some skin, back into a tray of water next to her. Her silver ring glistens under the florescent lights. A HUGE BRUISE runs across her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When   you didn't come back -- we went   looking for you. Found a dead   guy in the other building -- that   Mooney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Someone got to him before I did. Then went after me. (BEAT) How long was I out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie's eyes drift to the old man next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DELFY (cont'd) He's been looking after you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flashes a smile of crooked, yellow teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she starts to sit up, he protests, saying something in Russian. She ignores him. He walks away, mumbling something else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits up. Lifts her hand out of the water -- fingers are slow moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) I need to get back in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy and Carrie, with her hand bandaged, both slice the dark with flashlights. She's starting to get her bearings back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever it was, could have flown out after the storm broke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk a few silent beats, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DELFY (cont'd) Who's Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a moment before she responds --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let it go, Delfy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lets it go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same as before. Carrie goes to the over-turned sofa. Moves her light around -- searching. Passes over the blood on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until I met you, I hadn't seen any dead people. Now I'm at two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie gets on her knees -- looks under the sofa. Low angles her light. Something reflects.    Reaches in. Retrieves her baton --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as Carrie and Delfy leave the lounge, her perifocal vision picks up a wisp of light from a flashlight, which bled out from a door's threshold halfway down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy's eyes go wide -- Carrie's finger goes to her mouth - Shhhhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She instinctively pulls her baton with her left hand, but it hurts. She shifts it to the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns off her light.    Delphy does the same.   Motio for him to stay put.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heads to the source, keeping her baton ready and her back tight to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gets to the edge of the door.      It's open just slightl looks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sees a man in an ECW jacket with his back to her, holding a flashlight in one hand and digging through a duffle bag with his other. Items are strewn. Another bag has been completely turned inside out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She enters.    Baton cocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless you want your head cracked, I wouldn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His body tenses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Let me see your hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slowly raises them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Now turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does. He's a guy in his 30's. Although he's clean shaven, there's a rugged edge about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy comes up behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert Pryce. I'm a United Nations observer for the Oceanic and Antarctic section. If you relax, I've got my ID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see it -- slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he reaches into his liner --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be Stetko --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This throws her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRYCE (cont'd) I was heading to ASB to talk to you about Weiss when I was told you had come up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds out his ID for her.       As she reads --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know about Weiss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FBI notified us. Your base commander called it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie lowers her baton.    He stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRYCE (cont'd) I thought I might find answers in his gear, but there's nothing here but clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is part of a crime scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realize that, but considering the time constraints we're up against, let's be honest, taping and bagging everything isn't going to be an option.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be sure to let the U.N. know if I find out anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to walk away -- he follows, he's not done at all. Delfy brings up the rear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heading out to Delta One One?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll grab my bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't take this personally, but I don't need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they've been digging out there, that's a direct violation of the United Nations treaty. We think they were digging. That makes it my business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This stops her -- digging?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't dig for meteorites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you don't get killed for them either. This is now a U.N. matter. I am within my rights to commandeer your pilot and plane if I have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knows and her patience is running thin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. But this is my investigation, understand? If you obstruct it in any way, I will have you detained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues with Pryce next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if I ask you a personal question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I have the feeling you're going to anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you smell like suntan lotion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie and Delfy are heading toward the Ready Room. She has her phone to her ear. Two Russians trail behind with Mooney in a bodybag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy, listen to me, it's got to be Rubin who tried to kill me. You have to shut down flights leaving ASB and McMurdo -- search for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not possible. We're still bringing people in and resupplying other bases for Winter-over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thinks about it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, I think these guys found something out there at the camp. I'm going to check it out. Until I find Rubin, no one leaves the ice. Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She clicks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie opens the door to the ready room to find Pryce standing there with a gear bag -- typing into a PDA (Treo type).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finishes entering his text into the PDA.       Sends. it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delphy flies the plane over a labyrinth of deep, blue crevices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy's Twin Otter has landed beside the camp. There are TWO BIG TENTS and some scattered equipment - a SNOWCAT, a CHEST of TOOLS, DRUMS of GASOLINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky is dark with clouds and the wind MOANS.      A ha of wind-driven snow whips by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie, Pryce and Delfy climb out from the plane and make their way toward the tents. Place looks deserted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce glances to a watch strapped to the outside of his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A.M. or P.M.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A.M.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful. (re: tent) I'll take this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves toward tent one, Pryce the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie peers in. It's too dark to see anything. She goes to pull out her flashlight with her left hand -- stops herself. Reaches in with her right, extracts it from her pocket. Turns it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her FLASHLIGHT BEAM plays over a litter of personal effects, then picks up a TRAIL OF BLOOD leading to a cot between two others. Someone is huddled in a yellow sleeping bag on it. Her body tightens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps into the tent. Moves to the cot. There's a pool of blood underneath. Her heart pounds. She uses her flashlight, touches the sleeping bag. It doesn't move. She pulls at it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and discovers A PAIR OF ECW PANTS -- the LEFT LEG is soaked in blood.   No corpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steadies her breathing.      She pulls out a small ba from her pocket.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Uses the end of the flashlight to chip away a frozen blood sample from the pant leg. Puts it in the baggie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takes out her camera next.       Starts snapping.   Flash off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie enters with Delfy. Place is lit by a single dim bulb. This is a work space; two tables, instruments on top. Sample containers piled everywhere. Numerous photos of meteorites are stuck to a board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finds Pryce reading the crew's DAILY LOG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's left leg took a hit, lost a lot of blood. What do you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their daily work log.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy's drawn to a BIZARRE LOOKING PIECE OF EQUIPMENT; it's a red box on wheels with a handle like a lawn mower. A circular antennae sprouts from the front of the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like my dad's old lawn mower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ground penetrating radar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie moves over to a table with a MAP SPREAD OUT ON TOP. The ice field is marked off into sections.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like they were surveying sections at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Areas labeled?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's flipping back and forth through the pages --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At Sections 101 and 102, they spent one day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie finds them on the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRYCE (cont'd) 103 two days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie finds it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRYCE (cont'd) 104 -- seven days. That was a month ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other. Carrie finds it on the map as Pryce moves up next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like they hit some really big meteors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About four miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go see what they found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to check something out first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie has Mooney's bodybag unzipped and is examining his left leg. No cuts. No blood. She thinks on this non- discovery for a moment, then zips it back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAT'S tracks CLANK and CRUNCH as it powers across the featureless ice - the loneliest place on earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce is in the backseat, Delfy is driving. Carrie is next to him with the map and her GPS in hand. She stares at a tiny blinking red light on the GPS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASHING POLICE REDS reflect off the glass of the front doors of a hotel. Several squad cars are nosed up to the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrons and bystanders are perched in various locations, watching as A HANDCUFFED Carrie is escorted outside by two uniformed officers. Her eyes are full of tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's put into the backseat of one of the cars. As the door closes, she stares out the window where Coroners are loading a body under a sheet into the back of their truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy's looking at Carrie like he's waiting for an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said "which way?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances to the GPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: North.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce sees Carrie pause for a moment, massaging her gloved left hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can see it aches more than she's letting on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you been down here, Marshal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost two years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What brought you to the ice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pauses, humored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SARCASTIC) The excitement, mostly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone down here is running away from something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some shrink tell you that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and that I should call my mother more often

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you plant your boots?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got me working out of Christchurch, New Zealand. Beautiful country. But this -- crazy place to make a living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a moment, gazing out the window to the endless landscape of white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came down to fill in for a Marshal for six weeks before Winter-over. I met someone, decided to stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He give you that ring I saw? Tell you he was going to marry you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- just gave me a headache. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) I didn't see a ring on your finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flattered that you even looked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A faint beeping noise emanates from her GPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes go ahead as they drive on.   Looking.   Nothing but an icy plateau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
