dialogues.text: After a couple of beats --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy pulls to a stop.   They exit the cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three get cold-cocked by an invisible wind.      Carr steps away from the Cat. Pryce does too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes scan the ice with cool appraisal.    It's completely flat. Desert like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure this is right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Section 104.   These are the coordinates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you wrote them down wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie ignores him. Walks further away from the cat. Ice CRUNCHES UNDER HER FEET as she keeps looking -- then, she stops. Something's not right. Looks DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kneels to the ice. Scoops some up. Checks it out. Perplexed. Pryce approaches from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is shaved ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets to her feet. Walks further -- her eyes now paying close attention to the texture of the ice. After a dozen steps, texture changes. Ice is now smooth -- like it's supposed to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns around.   Tries to get the bigger picture. Looks at the ground all around her. Realizes a large area has been blanketed with shaved pieces of ice a few inches thick --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) They were digging, Pryce. And they tries to spread the ice to hide it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heads back across the area.       Scans the horizon. Takes another step forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOSH! In an instant, Carrie's gone! DISAPPEARS below the ice. Only a four foot wide hole remains, that was covered up with a white, iced-over tarp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce and Delfy move toward her -- each hesitating slightly, unsure of their own footing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce gets to the hole. Looks down. Carrie is precariously dangling in an ICE SHAFT that slopes at a slight angle. She's managed to grasp a protruding piece of ice, but she's fighting the pain in her left hand to hold on. It slips off. Below her -- nothing but darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Grab me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce lays flat. Reaches his hand down -- six inches too short. Delfy appears from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Delfy) Hold my legs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy does.    Pryce inches closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm slipping!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost got you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm losing my grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets closer.   Closer.    Moves to within an inch from hers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- She SLIPS.    Falls away.   Things become silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie?    Can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy peers over Pryce's shoulder into the abyss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (YELLING) Marshal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saw a rope in the Cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy springs to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darkness. A flashlight clicks on. Reflects off a wall of ice with a frozen blood trail leading up. Carrie gets to her feet. Sees that she's in a small dug out area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she slowly turns to get her bearings, her light falls on an ESCAPE HATCH of some kind, maybe three feet high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie shines the light to her feet.        The ground be her is metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce, with a flashlight in hand, lowers himself down a rope to the bottom of the shaft where Carrie waits. Delfy follows. Both take in the discovery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie moves over to the hatch. Pulls on it. Opens easily. She and Pryce hit the interior with their lights. Find themselves staring into...AN AIRPLANE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off their lights -- every surface scintillates with ice crystals from the frozen atmosphere, undisturbed except for recent tracks of footprints filing in and out -- they go forward and aft, disappearing into darkness. Place is tomb silent.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Twisted, and strewn with large containers scattered at odd angles -- victims of an intense IMPACT. The plane is pitched up at the nose, making their footing precarious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cargo plane, but I don't recognize it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an Antanov-74. Russian made - - late fifties. No one's put these in the air for forty years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie shuffles her way forward into the darkness, heading for the cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something BRUSHES her leg. She spins. Shines her light - - which illuminates a HAND, fingers in a clawed position - as if in excruciating pain. She whips her light past the hand, up the arm -- captures the FACE of a man staring at her! It takes a moment to realize -- he's dead, pinned between two large metal crates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy stands still. Staring.           Carrie throws a lo over her shoulder --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess that makes three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues on with Delfy staying close.         Her li targets the cockpit door. It's closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie pushes the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beam of her light reveals frozen blood SPLATTERED across a SHATTERED WINDSHIELD -- chunks of ice protruding through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Continues over three dead men in flight suits still strapped into seats, their broken bodies and ghastly expressions perfectly preserved. Each have a sidearm holstered around their waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't funny --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks back to Delfy -- gets confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Pryce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trailing her beam of light, Carrie and Delfy climb through a thick wall of nylon webbing. Enter a cluttered cargo area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ransacked Antarctic gear is strewn everywhere in a tangle of ropes and crampons, old ECW gear, and boxes of supplies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dipping into a case of bottles, Delfy pulls one free, sniffs, and drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vodka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie continues through the hold. Her FLASHLIGHT BEAM flickers over more chaos of the crash. HUGE STEEL TANKS TAKE UP MOST OF THE MID-SECTION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spots Pryce's flashlight holding on something just ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moves to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUSPICIOUS) Find what you're looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her light hits Pryce, who is focused on a HEAVY STEEL CAGE WELDED INTO THE AIRFRAME. Incredibly strong. And inside it is a STEEL SAFE. Door is open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce takes a beat -- turns to she and Delfy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just answers. (BEAT) Those are fuel tanks behind you. This plane was outfitted for long range capabilities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And by the looks of that safe, must've been transporting something pretty important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie moves in closer.   Sees that the cage has been breached.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Part of it has been damaged by the crash and this weakness has been ruthlessly attacked by the previous intruders until they forced an opening. Discarded tools litter the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They put some serious work into this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a pool of frozen blood near the opening -- where one of the torn, jagged bars of the steel cage is covered in blood --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever got hurt, they dragged him out of here. There's blood all over the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She uses her light to examine the interior of the safe more closely -- the frost on the shelves exposes SIX ROUND RUST RINGS where containers have been removed. Each one roughly measuring a foot tall, four inches wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PLANE SUDDENLY TREMBLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The muffled ROAR of a diesel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the Cat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRASH! -- the unmistakable sound of FALLING ICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRASHCRASHCRASH!    More ICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They scramble back through the darkness, the flashlight beams swinging wildly about the hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MORE ICE FALLS. It's getting louder as they're getting closer to the source.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie targets ahead with her light -- illuminates the hatch as A LOAD OF ICE DROPS IN covering it completely. Light fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonofabitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The continual sound of falling ice grows MUFFLED and DISTANT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie and Pryce both pull out their phones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No signal, you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shakes his head no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Someone followed us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIPCHIPCHIP!    Ice is flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things are desperate as a single flashlight beam propped up on a crate, illuminates Carrie, Delfy and Pryce hard at it -- frantically chopping away at the ice filled hatch with pieces of scrap metal from the plane. Efforts are big-- but the progress minimal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't going to work, it's like digging through concrete with a spoon. (BEAT) We're going to suffocate before we get out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long do you figure we've got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three of us down here -- 12, 15 hours at the most.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy looks at him with the intensity of a trapped animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. I'm not going out like this. No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light from the flashlight slowly begins to fade. Carrie goes over to the crate, slaps it against her leg, trying to get more juice going. Still fading. Light goes out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Screen goes black. Can't see a thing. A second later, ANOTHER LIGHT KICKS ON -- Pryce is holding it. Hands it over to Carrie --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DELFY (cont'd) And when that one goes -- we're screwed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carries mind whirls with her lack of options, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the Vodka -- we could make some torches, maybe melt the ice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire will burn the O2 quicker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What choice do we have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce knows she's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy looks to them both.    Desperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't need my vote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce heads to the back, his body becoming barely visible in the dissipating range of light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie takes a six-inch, pearl handled Buck knife from a pocket, unfolds it-- starts cutting the liner of her coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy moves to a nearby wooden crate. Goes to lift it, but it's frozen to the floor. Stomps on it. It breaks. Pulls pieces from the siding for torch sticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce comes back with a couple bottles.       Stops dead his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie looks over to see him staring at two LIFE JACKETS attached to the wall near the hatch. He's thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves to Carrie --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He exchanges the bottles for her flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shines the light to the ceiling as he heads toward the back, leaving Carrie and Delfy getting swallowed in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All these planes used to have bail- out hatches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We came in through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce goes back into the cargo area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has to be more than one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'd be on the ceiling in case of an ocean landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie watches Pryce's flashlight moving about in the cargo area of the aircraft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie and Delfy get to Pryce. They follow his beam straight up to expose an ESCAPE HATCH in the roof of the fuselage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRYCE (cont'd) With the angle of the plane, I don't think we're that far from the surface. Give me a hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce moves to a large crate -- starts to push it over. They join, sliding it over below the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jumps up onto it -- examines the hatch area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRYCE (cont'd) These are explosive bolts. If we blow the hatch, maybe it'll smash a hole up through the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or, if the ice is too thick the blast will come right back at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can be blown up, suffocate or freeze to death. Take your pick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce hands Carrie the flashlight. She targets the hatch area as he opens an electrical panel beside it; a crisscrossing maze of wires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he reaches up to examine the wiring, Carrie catches a GLIMPSE of a SHOULDER HARNESS under his liner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRYCE (cont'd) This could work -- give me the battery from your phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he looks down, Carrie masks her discovery.   Hands ove her phone. He extracts the BATTERY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRYCE (cont'd) When I connect these two wires, hopefully there's going to be a big bang. May want to take some cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce is nervous himself as he places one selected wire onto the battery, and prepares for another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks to Carrie and Pryce who have backed up against the fuselage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRYCE (cont'd) You guys ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie is still running that shoulder holster through her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce touches the last wire to the battery.   Nothing happens. Hope freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce tries again --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- KA-BOOM! The hatch EXPLODES INWARD, ricocheting around the inside of the cargo hold like a giant bullet coming in and out of their light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAM, SLAM, SLAM, until...WHAM, it buries itself edge-on, halfway into the fuselage, missing Carrie by a hair's width.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand there, deafened and stunned, then a shower of ice rains into the plane where the hatch used to be and a THIN SHAFT OF LIGHT DROPS into the cargo bay like a gift from God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallelujah --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce drops down.   Moves to another crate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy, help me with this.     We'll need to get up higher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy moves forward to help. The two of them push it over. It's a strenuous lift to get it on top of the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as they finish, Pryce turns to find himself facing Carrie holding one of the RUSSIAN'S GUNS TO HIS FACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce stares at her in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah -- what're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our friend here isn't who he says he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches into Pryce's liner, pulls out his sidearm from the shoulder holster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Switches it with the one in her hand.    Puts the Russian gun in her coat pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Didn't you know it's a direct treaty violation to carry a firearm down here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been authorized because of what's happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop lying to me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes out her handcuffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Delfy, cuff him to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds out the cuffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, the guy just saved our lives...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was saving his own.   Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy takes the cuffs from her.  Cuffs Pryce to some exposed piping. Carrie lowers her gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) You know what was in that safe. (BEAT) Now, who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees a moment of contemplation on Pryce's face --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) I swear I'll leave you here to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you got an ID for that too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me -- Forty eight hours ago, we picked up chatter between someone down here and Tahir Soufian, a black market trader in New York. It was all about setting up a buy for cannisters found in an old Russian transport buried in the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, I knew that government eavesdropping was true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's been rumors for years that the Russians had a second base -- a secret weapons research facility under the ice that supposedly blew up in the late sixties -- nothing was ever confirmed.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PRYCE (cont'd) The fact is, before the treaty in `72 they were strip mining all over the place down here -- we believe for uranium and other specialized minerals for weapon's use. It was the Cold War. No one knows half the things the Russian's were up to. This plane could be the link between rumor and truth. And if it is true, what's in those cannisters could be a prelude to another terrorist attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you lie to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, the U.N. carries a lot of weight down here. Think about it - - if I had told you I was C.I.A., you would have been on the horn back to Washington in no time. This is a very sensitive matter. News travels fast down here, I don't have to tell you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, I didn't know if I could trust you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie wrestles with her emotions. She looks back towards the open safe, the blood staining the airplane floor. Makes a decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy wriggles out from the hole. He reaches back. Helps Carrie to the surface. Pryce follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look around. The weather has deteriorated - the sky is dark with fast moving clouds. The wind is HOWLING. The Snowcat is parked over the hole, blade lowered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy runs over, jumps onto the CAT.   Looks inside the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keys are still in it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie notices a single set of an airplane's ski tracks in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plane could've gone anywhere. There's forty-six countries here all counting down to Winter-over. Rubin could just disappear in the mayhem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy starts up the Cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie pulls out her Nextel as Pryce takes out his PDA. She depresses the walkie button -- makes her way to the Cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Rhonda?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walkie crackles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (PISSED) Where the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heading back. How many fly-ins to McMurdo in the last four hours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You expect me to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SNAPS) -- How many?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a list of names.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie clicks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think Rubin might try to leave out of McMurdo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows I'm on his ass, so he might. Anything's possible. I want to eliminate his options.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She massages her gloved hand. Looks to Pryce who's talking on his PDA as he heads toward the Cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six cannisters, maybe four inches in diameter, about a foot high -- find out exactly what the Russians transported in something that size.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks to Carrie --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRYCE (cont'd) You have a photo of Rubin anywhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back at ASB --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Delfy) How long to get there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we get back to the plane, I'll get ya there in forty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Pryce climbs into the cat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And slides into the back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) I'll scan a picture of him and get it to you. Meanwhile, contact every non-American base down here and put them on watch. He's got some plan to get these off the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up. Carrie climbs in -- looks back at the plane's ski tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know why Weiss was so far from Delta One One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce and Delfy wait for the answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE cont'd) He was dumped from a plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes the door to the Cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie strides along the corridor with Pryce. They pass a window where we see that an LC-13O EVAC PLANE is parked out front -- it's tail section open like the mouth of a massive beast. Move past several people, balloons and `Eve of Evac' signs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce sees Carrie really cradling her left hand, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to get that looked at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have the Doc take a peek when we're done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinkle's pulling a DUFFLE BAG toward them.      Sees Carr and Pryce about to head up some stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy's looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy?   What the hell is he doing HERE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Came in on the evac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls Dinkle's two-way off his hip.       Hands it to Pryce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DINKLE (cont'd) Hey -- I don't turn that in, I have to pay for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on 30 if you need me. Rubin's picture is in a file on my desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinkle shoots Pryce the stink eye as he walks away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure I get that back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce heads up as Carrie continues on down the main corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy and Rhonda are standing next to the COMMS TECH, who is sitting in front of his COMPUTER. The screen revealing the SATELLITE IMAGERY of the storm It's grown and moving closer to ASB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's packing winds of a hundred thirty knots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy looks stressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit -- we've got to move up the evac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six hours at least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, I got crew that's still not in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then get them in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda is thrown off by his tone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to see me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy looks over.       Sees Carrie coming in through th door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't like his tone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buried under 2 tons of ice. You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me a favor, you find any more bodies, mind not parading them down the main corridor. I've got Newbies afraid to winterover, for Chirstsake. They want out on seats I don't have. And next time you want to take a Goddamn plane anywhere, you ask me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure thing, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have enough supplies for all of us to Winter-over if we get stuck down here. (BEAT) And you wonder why it didn't work out between us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It didn't work, Sam, because you couldn't keep your hands off every new woman who stepped foot on the ice down here. I was stupid enough to be one of them. Now if you could cut through your red tape for just one second, you would realize that someone's out there with six cannisters, possibly full of Uranium, and he wants to get it into the hands of some very bad people. And I'm trying to stop it -- so fuck asking you for shit, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is ridic---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SOUND OF A LARGE BOOK dropping onto the floor, sends a harsh reverb across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's attention goes to Doc standing at the door. He's really pissed. Glares at Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC (cont'd) What the hell's wrong with you, Murph? I've got bodies piling up in my lab, and she's the only one doing anything about it.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DOC (cont'd) (BEAT) Why don't you try helping her for a change?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy looks at Doc.   Not giving in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie calms down -- she's had enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what Doc, it's alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie looks to Rhonda --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) You got my list?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda pulls it from her clipboard.     Hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie walks out with Doc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SUBJECTIVE POV - watching Carrie and Doc from behind the crack of a door as they walk down the main corridor and right by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie's sitting on the edge of an examination table as Doc slowly unwraps her bandaged hand. She winces from the pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm worried about you. Is it going to take another attempt on your life to get you to finally slow down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him warmly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You worry too much -- but it's what I like about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc smiles, continues to unravel the gauze-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Doc, did you notice if Weiss had a wound on his left leg?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I striped him down to put him in a bodybag. There's only the puncture from the axe. No way, I would have noticed it. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it's gotta be Rubin. (BEAT) I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any word from the FBI?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way they're gonna make it. Not with that storm coming in over the peninsula.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gauze finally comes off, revealing her middle TWO FINGERS have turned COMPLETELY BLACK along with part of the flesh of her palm. Her ring looks strangely out of place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Oh God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc reaches over to a nearby drawer -- takes out a sterilized syringe packet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Carrie, how long did you let this go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens up the packet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did I go to Vostok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc puts the tip of the needle onto her blackened flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes hard -- penetrates the skin. We see the worry begin to elevate further on Carrie's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc tries the needle in another location.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly shakes her head.   He holds her gaze evenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC (cont'd) I have to amputate your middle two fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (STUNNED) No way. Don't tell me that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fingers are dead, Carrie. If I don't do it now, gangrene will set in. You'll lose your hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie is sickened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC (cont'd) I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie sits in sullen silence, the room dark around her. The only light bounces in from a sterile, draped area where Doc works on her hand. She can't watch as his CURVED SUTURE and thread, rises and falls with every stitch he makes. Carrie has her attention on BLOODY GAUZE piled up in a tray --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE'S MEMORY HIT: AN IMAGE SHE SAW EARLIER: The well defined chest of a man wearing a T-shirt. A BULLET HOLE oozes dead center. This time we stay there a little longer, watching the T-shirt absorb the blood around the wound. As the stain widens, so does the camera... slowly... bringing into picture THE MAN Carrie shot. He's wearing a MARSHAL'S BADGE around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie looks at him, sullen, afraid to look down.     The slowly lets her eyes drift to her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC (cont'd) It's going to be an adjustment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rises. Goes to a medicine cabinet. Selects a pill bottle. Shakes it. Only a couple inside. He returns with the pill bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC (cont'd) Should ease the pain. I'll look around, dig some more up for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at the vacant spot where her fingers used to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie's bag is open on the bed with the Russian's gun next to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's trying to put on a clean flannel over a T-shirt, but can't button it up with only one hand. Her frustration mounts as she fights back every bit of emotion that's trying to get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finally gives up -- kicks over a nearby chair that sweeps the stuff off her bed. Bag and gun go flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie slumps to the floor.    Silent tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a beat -- she notices Pryce standing in the doorway with some PAPERS in his hand. He's looking at her compassionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stopped by the clinic... Doc told me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie nods, pulling herself together, swallowing her emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty tough Marshal, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He enters.    Holds out her ring for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) (holds up hand with missing ring FINGER) If you came to propose, now's not really a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He joins her.    Hands over her ring.     Takes a seat ne her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got Rubin's face all over Antarctica, but nobody's seen him yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit in silence together for a moment. Carrie sees the Russian pistol that's ended up on the floor close by. Picks it up. Examines it like a relic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You ever kill anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Unfortunately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone you ever trusted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hadn't held a gun in my hand for over two years. (LAUGHING) Wasn't supposed to need one down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) You asked what I was running away from...I came down here to forget my partner, Jack. Thought it would be better than any therapy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were on a stakeout at a Holiday Inn in Miami, waiting for this buy to go down. I was excited, we'd been after this trafficker for a long time. Thought this bust would be my big chance to impress the brass. Anyway, guy's a no show. One hour went by, then two - - nothing.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Then Jack starting acting strange. Next thing I knew my face was being rammed into a mirror. My own partner was trying to kill me. Turns out the whole bust was a set up from the start. Jack was dirty, working with the guy we were after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Four years together. I knew things about him that his wife didn't even know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he was my partner and I killed him that night. There's no changing that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce takes it all in.   Not the story he expected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Marshall service cleared me -- ruled it self-defense, but I had a real hard time getting over the betrayal -- how little my life meant to a guy I was willing to take a bullet for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie shifts in her chair.   Leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Know what the kicker is -- Jack thought I was close to figuring him out. Thought this hotel room was the best place to get rid of me -- make it look like a bust gone bad. Truth is, I had no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I was young and stupid, and in way over my head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands.   Pryce joins her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) You asked me why I smell like suntan lotion -- Jack wore Aramis, this cheap after-shave his wife gave him. Some of the guys down here wear it -- suntan lotion is the only thing that keeps me from smelling it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She notices the papers he's holding; faxed photos of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) What do ya got there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shows them to her.   One-by-one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what the Russians used to transport weapons grade materials in. They match the dimensions inside the safe. We're looking for six of these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Carrie studies them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRYCE (cont'd) Langley's thinking it might be Hexafluoride, which is a derivative of Uranium. It's a component for nuclear detonation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These beakers where really in over their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RADIO on Pryce's hip -- crackles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinkle, it's Rhonda --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce smirks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better get this back to him. And we have to find Rubin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think you can you help me with these buttons, first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves closer.   Starts to button her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRYCE (cont'd) For what it's worth -- I think you're pretty tough, Marshall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie enters. Light streaming in through the window hits her tired face. She reaches for the light switch on the nearby wall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- AGGRESSIVELY YANKS her away from the open door. It's kicked closed as she's drawn backwards into a man's embrace. A knife's brought to her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raspy, deep) ...You Stetko?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie nods -- slides her hand toward her pocket...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAN (cont'd) Don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slowly turns her around to face him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- it's Rubin, but he looks beat to shit. Deep cracks slice across his bloody, chapped lips. Peeling skin flakes on his face. Desperate, despondent eyes. Shaky, frostbitten fingers. He's having a hard time holding it together as he can barely get the words out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Did Mooney talk to you? I didn't hear from him -- he was supposed to call me after you talked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie's confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mooney's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so's Weiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods - he knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm next, I know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, you're safe, just put the knife down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His shaking hands slowly lowers it -- she breathes a little easier. He sets it down on an empty book shelf next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Who's after you? Where are the cannisters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares off blankly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weiss didn't want to go through with it. Oh God. How did we let this happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubin -- I need you to focus for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries. Looks at her through tired, pinched eyes -- he's trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O.C. KNOCK. KNOCK on her door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubin is spooked.    Glares at her -- scared.   Like a ca animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie, it's Doc -- got those painkillers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, he's a doctor, he can help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It falls on deaf ears -- he goes for the knife.    She tries to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubin shoves her aside, throwing her against a chair. She topples backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He whips open the door, driving an unexpected shoulder into Doc, who gets nailed so hard, he goes stumbling back up against the wall behind him. Takes the wind right out of him. Pills all over the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubin dashes off down the hallway -- it's an effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie appears at the door. Catches a glimpse of Rubin disappearing down a set of side stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) You alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes off after him, pulling her phone off her hip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes two at a time -- keys the two-way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Pryce --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubin's here! He's on the run. Level one. White T-shirt. Jeans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Carrie comes off the stairs -- looks left -- there's three guys carrying boxes out of a room. Snaps a look to the right --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Rubin's at the far end, slipping through a doorway that leads into an INTERCONNECTING TUNNEL to another part of ASB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) (into walkie) He's heading for the Science Lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie kicks it into high --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SUBJECTIVE POV - catches interval glimpses of Rubin through the small windows that run along the side of the tunnel as he dashes through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubin is moving through to a door at the far end as Carrie enters. It's lined with several free standing, empty bookcases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubin, wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie enters through the connecting tunnel's doorway. Not a lot of light. Slows her pace. It's quiet. Dormant. Vacant lab stations. Room's been shut down for the winter. Eyes scan. Fall upon --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- A DOOR ACROSS THE ROOM.   A sign above reads: READY ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes off again, slaloming her way around the lab stations to get to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie gets to the door. Pulls on the handle. Won't open. Rattles. Looks in through a viewing window -- sees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- a panicked Rubin inside, grabbing ECW gear off a rack mounted to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Carrie exchange glances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubin -- I can help you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tugs harder on the doors. Stuck. Looks through the window to see he's tied them together with some climbing rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that same instant a shaft of brilliant daylight floods half the room as the outside door is whipped open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN in full ECW - stands in the doorway. He's wearing a FACE MASK and GOGGLES. Holds an ICE AXE poised, ready to strike -- it's the same guy who attacked her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubin bolts back toward the door separating he and Carrie, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- SWOOOSH! THE ICE AXE is buried into his shoulder, gaffing him like a fish. The pain's excruciating for Rubin, who spins on his attacker like a wild man. BULLDOZES into him, driving him back out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both TUMBLE down a steep set of stairs -- the exposed end of the ice axe gets stuck in a step's steel meshing on the way down -- rips out of Rubin's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubin eats the pain as he gets to his feet. Takes off. Runs blindly with panting intensity verging on hysteria. Disappears around the contour of ASB before the other guy can get to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His assailant rises. Goes back up a couple steps to retrieve his embedded ice axe, but finds it wedged so tight, it won't budge. Abandons it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie shoulders the door, but still doesn't budge. Hears FOOTSTEPS BEHIND HER. Turns to see it's Pryce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Door's jammed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce latches on to a heavy SUPPLY CART filled with beakers, micro-scopes and other gear, that's tucked against one of the lab stations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Pryce, it's not Rubin --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off his confused look --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Someone's trying to kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce picks up speed as he targets the door. Hits it like a freight train, busting it open! Cart goes crashing. Contents scatter like buckshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two of them are hit with icy cold coming in through the open exit door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie throws a look outside -- bottom of stairs are vacant. Ice axe is still there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, Rubin doesn't have any gear on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie immediately closes the outside door. Pryce goes for the ECW wear. Scrambles to get a coat on. Carrie joins. Same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long's he been out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubin staggers as he follows a line of storage bins tucked against the base of the main building. The blood from his wound already frozen on his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cold -- it's killing him. Body's shaking.    The sun' reflection off the ice is blinding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- His vision begins to cloud as the corneas are literally being burned by the intense light. He tries to shield them -- has little effect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over his shoulder -- gets a BLURRED IMAGE of his attacker not far behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubin trips. Hands go to the icy ground to protect his fall. Still hits hard. Starts to get up, but his palms are frozen to the surface. Doesn't have time to care -- pulls hard, tearing the skin right off. Stands. Spins around in a panicked whirl -- he's lost ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Continues to the end of the storage bins. Moves under ASB, using the enormous HYDRAULIC LIFT COLUMNS to conceal his movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up ahead -- forty yards away -- hope. He continues toward some storage containers and the SNOW MELTER on the other side, where TWO PEOPLE, CLAD IN ECW are finishing filling an insulated container with water from an insulated hose mounted to the Melter.   A snowmobile is parked next to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to scream, but only a dull, raspy, muffled voice escapes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys -- oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie and Pryce, now bundled up in ECW, exit the room and head down the stairs. Split up -- go opposite directions around the complex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubin's pace is slowing -- he's exerting himself to get to the people as they climb into snowmobile with the container.   Frostbite is chewing up his lungs. He's too slow, they take off. He coughs up blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: W..wa..wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns around to check on his pursuer.   Twenty feet away and closing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubin's eyes desperately search for some kind of weapon - anything. Sees the insulated hose on the SNOW MELTER. Heads for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie passes a gap between storage containers where several snow shovels are stuck into a mound of snow -- through their vertical slats, SHE CATCHES A GLIMPSE OF RUBIN at the Snow Melter across on the other side of the main building. Sees the ECW guy closing in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce is moving under ASB. Passes a hydraulic support leg. Spots Carrie on the other side moving toward Rubin. Also sees the ECW guy in pursuit. Heads toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubin's frostbitten hand reaches for the hose. Grabs it, but he doesn't have the strength to turn it on. Throws a defeated glance over his shoulder to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- THE VILLAIN in ECW gear right on him! Shoves Rubin against the tank. Grabs the hose from him. Turns it on - - SPRAYING him head to toe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubin's clothes turn to ice. One eye freezes shut. Lips go cobalt blue. He tries to escape, but several stiff steps away, he slows and finally stops: a prisoner in his ice-locked clothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man moves to Rubin.   Grabs his head, and - SNAP - breaks his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubin's body topples stiffly to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda crosses the busy room. Reaches for a clipboard hanging next to the window. Something outside catches her attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks to Murphy, who is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy and the others join her at the window. They see Rubin on the ground, but the Snow Melter blocks any view of the killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Killer turns to leave the crime scene and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- WHACK! He's blindsided by a SHOVEL to his head. Goggles shatter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie pulls his parka hood away from his head -- snaps the goggle from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's KELLER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood trickles from the fresh wound to his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shovel's courtesy of Carrie, who stands over top of him. Holds the shovel to his neck like a guillotine blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce approaches. Glances to Rubin's frozen body -- neck askew. Carrie is wound up. Keller's still recovering from the impact --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sh... sh... shoulda killed you at Vostok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the cannisters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me drag him over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They each take his jacket by the shoulder -- pull him back over to the Snow Melter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Keep him still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands the shovel to Pryce, who puts it to Keller's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie pulls her Buck knife from her back pocket, then whips off Keller's gloves. Tosses them aside. The cold makes him more coherent. Sees Pryce at this throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Tahir selling it to -- what's the intended target?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keller shifts his attention to Carrie, who's using her knife to SLICE open his ECW jacket and pants, exposing bare arms and legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing, you crazy bitch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keller instantly starts to shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you kill those scientists, Keller? Was a four-way split too much for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie grabs the hose from the Snow Melter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She brutally stomps on Keller's exposed arm, douses him with water from the hose, welding his arm to the ground as it freezes instantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the uranium?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost smug) You have no idea what's going on here, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keller begins to shiver violently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit the sonofabitch again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie releases more water, freezing more of the arm. screams. Pain is too much. He caves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane, they're in the fucking plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie's suddenly grabbed from behind.     It's Murphy. Furious. Two other guys at his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you completely lost your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She twists free of his grasp.      Gets in Keller's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Where in the plane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find them yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cannisters are on the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks to the guys that came out with Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Throw him in the holding cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two guys go to Keller, but his arm is stuck to the ground. Carrie kicks it free. It's painful. Keller screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys lift him to his feet.     Haul him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy looks to Pryce --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie looks at Pryce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name's Pryce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce looks at Carrie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's with the UN. We have to search that plane now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy looks to Carrie with an intense glare --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have time. We'll just search it in Christchurch when it lands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce steps in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a twelve hour flight to Christchurch. Anything can happen in that time. Keller is here, so we know it's still on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PRYCE (cont'd) Once that plane is in the air, we've as good as lost it. Just give us 10 minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy looks to Carrie, softens slightly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, do what is right here.    Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what you have to, but that plane takes off in one hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll need some help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll send what I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie is near the cockpit, searching under a row of seats. Pryce approaches. A handful of ASB employees tear through every inch of the fuselage and cargo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie gets to her feet.    Pissed off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRYCE (cont'd) You check the cockpit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. That bastard. What the hell are you up to, Keller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it, why lie to us -- we have him either way. He's stuck here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie's suddenly chilled with the ominous reality that -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's buying time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie races off the plane.    Pryce tries to keep pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie is slaloming her way through the corridor, which is packed with ASB employees carrying their bags for the evac. Pryce is close behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie enters. Pryce at her side. Her face goes white. The door to the holding room is wide open. Keller's GONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got nowhere to go, nowhere to hide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it hits her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't try.    He's a goddamn pilot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the two of them take off for the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy walks across the floor. Hangar is minimally lit. Still. Silent. Void of personnel. The Otters are lined up. The Snowcats and snowmobiles on the other side. He heads toward an Otter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy reaches in and gets his son's picture, which is still hanging on the console. Then, something catches his attention through the windshield of his plane. He sees a FUEL HOSE running to another plane -- and it's pumping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curious, he gets out of the Otter. Eyes dart about the hangar. Doesn't see anyone. Heads to the other plane. Discovers that a door is open on the other side. Takes a another look around. Doesn't see anyone. Moves closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gets to the plane.   Takes a look inside, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUD!   He's nailed with a giant Crescent wrench to the head.   Stumbles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keller leaps out, grabbing hold of a staggering Delfy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruthlessly runs him head first into a standing tool chest. Delfy collapses to the ground in a heap. Unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie and Pryce, dressed in ECW are making their way toward the hangar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Employees are trudging up through the back entrance into the plane. Get checked off a list by the LOAD MASTER. Toss their gear into a netted cargo area. Find a seat. Plane is nearly full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keller has the engine going. It's loud. Preps the console for flight, flipping switches -- suddenly sees Carrie and Pryce enter the hangar. Guns drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shift their attention to the plane.    Blades turning. Th stalk forward. Slowly. Carefully.      Eyeing for any betrayal of movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, with a nod from Carrie, they move in. Fast. Ready. Look into the plane. It's empty, except for a duffle bag in the back. Carrie nods to Pryce. Motions for him to go one way, she'll go another.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE AND PRYCE
dialogues.text: Carrie eyeballs a Snowcat. It's door is slightly open. She heads for it. Gun poised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce moves to check the next plane.    Eyes dart to ever dark corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie gets to the Cat.    Springs toward the door. Inside's empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce walks under THE WING of the next plane. Spots Delfy just ahead on the ground by the tool chest. Looks like he's stirring into consciousness. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWOOSH!! An ICE AXE swings down from above, embedding in his Pryce's chest. Deep. It sticks. Gun goes flying. Keller drops down from the wing above. Pryce staggers. Keller kicks him hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce goes down.   Keller grabs the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Points it right at Pryce -- before he can shoot --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG!BANG! Bullets zip by Keller, who rolls for cover behind SOME EQUIPMENT. Another rips into his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keller spots Carrie over by the Cat. She fires continually, forcing him to stay behind cover. The shots go wide -- she's not yet used to firing with the right hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keller blindly reaches his gun around the chest -- shoots back, which --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Gives Pryce enough time to painfully crawl for cover beneath the plane. He's losing blood quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie keeps shooting. Bullets PING OFF THE TOOL CHEST. They stop. Carrie has to reload.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keller makes his move. Fires at Carrie and sprints for his plane. Runs right by pole with a large red button attached to it. Slams it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TEMPERATURE immediately begins to PLUMMET as winter is let inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keller keeps shooting.   Runs out of bullets.   Leaps int the idling Otter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie makes her move.   Dashes toward him, firing away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullets PLANT in the WINDSHIELD, but can't penetrate -- glass is too thick -- protection from the cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keller throttles. Begins to move the Otter forward toward the opening doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie dashes to Pryce. Sees Delfy get to his feet. Face bloody. He moves to Pryce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets over to the guys quickly, giving Delfy a visual once over. He'll be fine, but things look bad for Pryce. He's bleeding profusely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kneels beside him -- pulls the tip of the axe out of his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy looks to the hangar doors, which are nearly open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I didn't see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes flutter shut.   Carrie slaps his face --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!    You stay awake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puts her hand directly on the wound.   Applies pressure. Blood continues to ooze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks over to Keller just as his plane exits the hangar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks back to Pryce's wound -- won't stop bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Damn it! (to Delfy) Come on. We're getting him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lift him to his feet. Haul ass to the front of the hangar the best they can. Go outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two of them place the now unconscious Pryce to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie grabs Delfy's hands. Puts them directly on the bloody wound. Surprisingly, he stays focused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Press here.    Hard. Hard or he will die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks Delfy right in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not going to be number four!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce moans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie rips open Pryce's jacket and liner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scoops up an armful of wind-blown ice. Starts packing it around him. Keeps repeating the motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She keeps shooting looks to Keller's departing plane moving toward the runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cold hits Pryce, shocking him awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (GASPING) What are you doing?   Get Keller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're bleeding out. Freezing drops your pulse. We have to slow it down. (BEAT) You hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie snags the two-way off her hip like it's a quick draw. Keys it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Sam -- is Doc on the plane yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- what's going --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keller got out. He hurt Pryce -- he's bleeding bad. Where's Doc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the clinic. About to bring the bodies out. What's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him to stay put, and I need your help getting Pryce there. We're at the hangar. I've got to stop Keller, he's got the cannisters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie doesn't wait for an answer.     Gives Delfy the tw way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Don't let him die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie stands.   Determined.   Sprints back into the hangar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a full sprint, Carrie dashes over to the Snowmobiles. Coughs. Spits blood. Doesn't stop her. She jumps on one. Fires it up. Uses her left palm to steer -- blood starts to seep through the gauze. She quickly bundles up, then guns it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubber treads grip. Smoke rises. She races it across the cement floor and out the hangar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off in the distance, Keller's heading for the front of the runway -- has to turn around to take off into the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie veers off, targeting the tunnel to ASB.    Hits he light as she races in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie's light silhouettes Murphy and a couple of his guys as they head toward her. She doesn't even slow down as she blows right by them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desperation clings to his face as he turns the plane onto the runway. His wound oozes blood -- eats the pain as he gives it full throttle. Starts to pick up speed. Heads down his strip of freedom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A funnel of bumpy light spreads across the ice before Carrie on the snowmobile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds tight as she burns a big U-TURN around one of the berms and onto the runway.   Heads straight for the lights of Keller's plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees Carrie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crazy bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She targets him like a Japanese zero.       Hundred yards closing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's pushing to get airborne.        Seventy-five yards b them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gap narrows fast.    Fifty yards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay on Carrie. Looks like suicide. She suddenly swerves a hard left, disappearing behind a berm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bears a momentary sense of triumph, starts to get airborne -- until -- LAUNCHING UP OFF THE BERM is Carrie's snowmobile! She bails, letting it continue right toward him like a heat seeking missile as she tumbles down the berm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keller's pov - a THOUSAND POUNDS of snowmobile comes at him fast -- obliterates the cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cripples the plane, pitching it sideways. A wing catches the runway, CATAPULTING the entire plane into a cartwheel of disaster as it veers off the runway and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Resume -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie slowly gets to her feet. The flames reflecting off her goggles. She heads to the wreckage. The cold and blowing snow extinguishing the flames quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie approaches. Only a sputtering of flame remains on the front of the twisted remnants of the Otter's cockpit. The aft seems relatively intact. Carrie looks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sees the charred and already frozen remains of Keller. In the back -- the charred duffle bag. She moves closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaches in through a broken window.       Pulls it out to runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unzips it.    Is confused.    No cannisters.   Only survi gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delfy, along with Murphy and his two guys, carry Pryce in. Doc's in the back room with two others, loading the BODYBAGS onto a cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc quickly moves into the front room.      The other two follow. Curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc springs into action, pulling on gloves.       Pryce's face, ashen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him on the table!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They usher him onto one. He looks to Delfy who still has his hand on Pryce's wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC (cont'd) Don't move that hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know, he'll die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc shifts his attention to one of Murphy's guys --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, four units O-pos in the warmer. Second shelf, fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy heads for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie enters. She's still in her ECW gear.        Heart when she sees Pryce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc leans over Pryce's pale form.        Examines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Doc gets an IV going, he looks to Carrie --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC (cont'd) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keller hit him with an ice axe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He get away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy's walkie on his hip CRACKLES to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda's standing up front with the pilot and Copilot, watching the horizon where dark storm clouds are coming at them like a tidal wave. Brings a walkie to her lips...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, it's Rhonda -- we gotta go. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.    I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy looks to Doc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you do this on the plane? It's your call, but I need to know now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc, who's wrestling with deep contemplation, looks to Carrie -- she sees the answer's no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll stay with you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his guys) Grab the bodies and get them on the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys head for the back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Doc looks at Pryce -- knowing he needs him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave the bodies -- you don't have time. Dead is dead. (BEAT) Pick them up in six months. Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc looks to Carrie, who's thankful --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys after the bodies look to Murphy for a decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave'm.   Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy and Carrie exchange a quick look -- closure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes off with the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind   is hurricane fierce as Murphy and his two men are just   about to board the plane. Murphy looks to the storm --   a forboding darkness getting closer by the second.    He realizes they might not make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LC-130's jet engines roars as he gains speed down the runway -- faster and faster, then it suddenly gets swallowed in the storm -- like an avalanche covering a skier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera stays on the fast moving storm, the plane, nowhere in sight, until --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LC-130 finally pushes out the front of it -- AIRBORNE. Takes off into the horizon, where we see that the sun is just about to set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie is standing next to Pryce on the examination table. He's been bandaged up. Eyes closed. Looks thrashed. An IV drip hangs from a stand on wheels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's looking at him with soft, caring eyes -- been through a lot. He slowly opens his. Tries to smile, not easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um-hm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cannisters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both think on it for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did we miss? Think Keller cut and run without the stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After all this, no way. Keller didn't have it on the plane because he's got it hidden somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where would he hide something for six months. Somewhere he could be sure no one would ever look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he had made it out, he wouldn't have been crazy enough to come back for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True -- what the hell was his plan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce thinks hard -- he's got nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got six months to figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SQUEAKY NOISE in the back of the room draws their attention. It's Doc coming through with the cart -- a bodybag on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes open -- that's always a good sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He continues pushing the gurney toward them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Doc -- thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank her -- if she hadn't slowed your bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc rolls the gurney behind her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC (cont'd) I'm going to hunt me down a bottle of scotch --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie turns, looks at Doc as he wheels the gurney by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need any help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
