dialogues.text: She sees it's Weiss' name on the tag, but something disturbing catches Carrie's eye -- it's Weiss' LEFT LEG pressing against the bag. Although the plastic is clouded, she'd swear his LEFT CALF has a LONG LINE OF STITCHES running down the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC (cont'd) You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice pulls her focus.          She masks her startle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (COVERING) Just thinking where it all began.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's a damn shame, isn't it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc continues on out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce sees that she's bothered --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing -- I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heads out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie slips in. We've been here before -- this is where she chased Rubin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darkness creeps in, phantom like, as the remaining daylight FADES OUT through the row of windows that run along the side. Carrie's plunged into inky black. WINTER HAS SET IN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She HEARS the Science Lab door open before her -- peers through the dark blanket to see Doc walking toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie slips in between two bookcases, trying to stay tight against the wall. Doc walks right by and out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rises to her feet. Hurries down to the end. Disappears into the science building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie enters. Turns on the light. Illuminates the lab stations, and the busted open doors of the Ready Room. Heads for the freezer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie opens the door.    Illuminates the interior with h light.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Storage racks of frozen science samples line the three walls. Lying on the floor are the bodies of Mooney, Rubin, Weiss and Keller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carry goes to Weiss' body. Kneels next to him. Goes to unzip the bodybag, but sees that it's been locked with a plastic cinch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulls out her knife. Holds the light steady in her mouth as she cuts the cinch. Unzips the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her light travels down his body to his left leg. She rolls it slightly for a better look. The truth hits her like a sledge hammer. There it is, like standing center stage in her light, the ROW OF STITCHES holding a deep gash tight together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's about to stand and walk out, but she stops herself. Thinks about that leg, those stitches. The fact that Doc lied to her. Pans her light over at the other bodies on the floor. Her light pans back, explores the rest of Weiss' upper body -- sees a dried river of blood that's run out from under his armpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself) Someplace no one would ever think to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She raises Weiss' arm.    More stitches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cuts through them. Skin splits to reveal the BOTTOM OF A CANNISTER that's been stuffed inside his chest. She reaches in and pulls it out. Even has rust on the bottom. Carrie's confused -- IT'S NOT LIKE ANY OF THE CANNISTERS PRYCE SHOWED HER PHOTOS OF. It look more like THE ICE CORE CONTAINER SHE SAW AT MCMURDO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She contemplates opening it for a moment, then places her hand on the top. Begins to twist. It loosens easily. Pulls the lid off. Looks at it. Whatever it is, it's frozen. Tilts the can slightly, and out slides a FOOT LONG ICE CORE SAMPLE. Can't quite figure it out, until she shines her light on it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The freezer DANCES WITH GLISTENING LIGHT. The core sample is PACKED FULL OF DIAMONDS. She looks to the other two bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens Mooney's bag. Sees his chest is uneven -- more cylinders inside. Repeats the action with Rubin. Same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie slowly stands -- the betrayal almost too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they had just gone along with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns -- Doc is standing right BEHIND HER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC (cont'd) Those fools found a plane -- had no idea what they stumbled onto. Turns out the Russians had discovered a diamond field while drilling for core samples in the sixties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we thought it was nukes the whole time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keller said he knew someone in the states who could move the diamonds for us. It was a hell of a lot of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get wrapped up in thing, Doc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weiss got hurt on the plane. They were afraid to move him, so Mooney called me. Keller and I flew out. But they couldn't get the safe open -- Keller found a way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Weiss got cold feet. It got ugly, didn't it -- and Keller killed him at Delta One One. Everything went to hell after that, didn't it, Doc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keller thought he could kill his way out of this whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If those idiots hadn't panicked, none of this would have happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and walks out of the freezer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie carefully follows. Sees he's heading for KELLER'S ICE AXE in the ready room, that someone's removed from being wedged outside, onto the now uprighted LAB CART Pryce used to bust open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc -- stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does. Turns back to her. But there has been a subtle shift inside him -- something illogical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll cut you in, Carrie. There's at least 5 million in diamonds in there. That can buy both of us a nice life back in the world. How many times have we both talked about having a fresh start. Well, this is it. Those beakers finding that plane was a sign. A sign telling me it was time to go back. Now I have something to go back for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has a realization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no granddaughter, is there? This was about greed, plain and simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one will ever know. It's just me and you. We can take care of Pryce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His callus disregard for human life rocks her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead is dead, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes, now you're getting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happened to you? There are four people dead! Four! People we knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc looks at her.   She's not sure if it's registering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) Where you going to stuff my body too? Huh? Was I going to be five?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to the ice axe and starts walking towards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls the gun out from inside her liner, her mind a whirl of limited options and grim solutions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nears the ice axe on the cart --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie cocks back the trigger --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE (cont'd) I won't go through it again. Don't make me shoot you, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her knuckle on her trigger finger goes white as she wrestles with her emotions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's either ignore all of this or kill me -- and you and I, we're too good of friends for me to force you to make that choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that...he walks right past the ICE AXE and into the READY ROOM. She's confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc, your not thinking straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's not listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya know, it's really warm. I'm gonna take a walk -- try and cool off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TEMPERATURE GAUGE on the wall reads: -82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie crosses the room as he grabs onto the outside door's latch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He musters a smile --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, Carrie -- freedom's just a sunrise away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using both hands on the latch, he pulls. THE DOOR BLASTS OPEN, filling the space between Carrie and Doc with violent winds and blowing snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc's throws one last look to Carrie, then takes two steps out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disappears into the blanket of white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wind and cold storm into the room against Carrie, who remains standing still like a statue. Emotionally drained. Numb. Freezing to death -- tears frozen to her cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shadow passes by her -- it's Pryce. He's hunkered over in pain, but forcing himself against the driving force of the wind into the Ready Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Latches onto the door. It takes everything he's got, but he manages to get it closed. Instant silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold to the bone, he grabs a jacket off the racket. Approaches Carrie, who remains staring at the closed door. The effects of the chill and Doc's decision apparent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce wraps the coat around her shoulders.   Gently leads her away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Super: THREE MONTHS LATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sounds of lapping surf and distant seagulls serenades us like a rhythmic lullaby as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU on sand with a shadow of a palm tree casting over top of two pairs of feet -- intertwined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly widen -- to see Carrie and Pryce, kicking back on lawn chairs, side-by-side. Two heat lamps pouring out bright, warm light. A cut out piece of paper in the shape of a palm leaf is taped to one of the lamps -- throwing the shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pryce has a small bandage over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie lies back, rests, eyes closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the weather where you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot. But there's a gentle breeze. Fiji's beautiful this time of year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, St. Barts ain't bad either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lie there quietly, relishing the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRYCE (cont'd) Six months.   Six long months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie turns over on her stomach -- lets the heat warm her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. Freedom's just a sunrise away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a new calender on the wall, where the days of Winter-over have been marked off -- long way to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull away from the building, which fades into the icy darkness and howling wind of the Antarctic winter.
